docs.summary:
An implementation of the standard [Javascript Fetch API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API)
 which can be used in public and backend code for fetching resources
 from [3rd party services](https://support.wix.com/en/article/accessing-3rd-party-services)
 using HTTPS.
description: To make a request, call the [fetch()](#fetch) function with the path to a
resource and the optional [`WixFetchRequest`](#WixFetchRequest) options. The
returns a promise that resolves to a [`WixFetchResponse`](wix-fetch.WixFetchResponse.html).
The response object contains a number of properties and functions for
retrieving the response's information.
The Fetch API can be used in your front-end or backend code.
To use the Fetch API in the backend, import the `fetch` function from the
`wix-fetch` module:
``` javascript
import {fetch} from 'wix-fetch';
The implementation of the Fetch API differs slightly depending on where it's
being used. The features documented here comprise the base functionality for
both implementations. However, each implementation contains additional features:
+ In public files, the native browser's
Fetch API is used.
+ In backend files the node-fetch module is used.

srcDocs.summary:
An implementation of the standard [Javascript Fetch API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API)
 which can be used in public and backend code for fetching resources
 from [3rd party services](https://support.wix.com/en/article/accessing-3rd-party-services)
 using HTTPS.
description: To make a request, call the [fetch()](#fetch) function with the path to a
resource and the optional [`WixFetchRequest`](#WixFetchRequest) options. The
returns a promise that resolves to a [`WixFetchResponse`](wix-fetch.WixFetchResponse.html).
The response object contains a number of properties and functions for
retrieving the response's information.
The Fetch API can be used in your front-end or backend code.
To use the Fetch API in the backend, import the `fetch` function from the
`wix-fetch` module:
``` javascript
import {fetch} from 'wix-fetch';
The implementation of the Fetch API differs slightly depending on where it's
being used. The features documented here comprise the base functionality for
both implementations. However, each implementation contains additional features:
+ In public files, the native browser's
Fetch API is used.
+ In backend files the node-fetch module is used.

params.name: url
params.doc: The url of the resource to fetch.
params.srcDoc: The url of the resource to fetch.

ret.doc: undefined. on fulfilled - The HTTP response of the fetch operation. on rejected - The error that caused the rejection.
ret.srcDoc: on fulfilled - The HTTP response of the fetch operation. on rejected - The error that caused the rejection.

docs.summary: Retrieves the specified resource from the network using HTTPS.
description: The `fetch()` function fetches an HTTPS resource from the network. It returns
a Promise that resolves to a [`WixFetchResponse`](wix-fetch.WixFetchResponse.html)
object representing the HTTP response to the request.
Responses with an HTTP status code in the ranges 2xx, 4xx, and 5xx are
considered fulfilled. Use the {@link wix-fetch.WixFetchResponse#ok|`httpResponse.ok`}
property to confirm that the HTTP request was successful with a response
code in the 2xx range.

examples.title: Get a resource and the response information

srcDocs.summary: Retrieves the specified resource from the network using HTTPS.
description: The `fetch()` function fetches an HTTPS resource from the network. It returns
a Promise that resolves to a [`WixFetchResponse`](wix-fetch.WixFetchResponse.html)
object representing the HTTP response to the request.
Responses with an HTTP status code in the ranges 2xx, 4xx, and 5xx are
considered fulfilled. Use the {@link wix-fetch.WixFetchResponse#ok|`httpResponse.ok`}
property to confirm that the HTTP request was successful with a response
code in the 2xx range.

examples.title: Get a resource and the response information

docs.summary: An object used by the `fetch()` function representing an HTTPS request.
description: The `WixFetchRequest` object contains information about an HTTPS request.
More functionality is available in each of the respective [Fetch API implementations](#implementations).

srcDocs.summary: An object used by the `fetch()` function representing an HTTPS request.
description: The `WixFetchRequest` object contains information about an HTTPS request.
More functionality is available in each of the respective [Fetch API implementations](#implementations).

members.name: method
members.docs: The [HTTP method](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods) to use (if omitted, defaults to `"GET"`).
members.srcDocs: The [HTTP method](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Methods) to use (if omitted, defaults to `"GET"`).
